{"title": "App Pack 1", "title_search": "app pack 1", "title_keyword": "app pack 1", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/app-pack-1/", "summary": "Ten Games for just 99c! ******************************* This compilation contains TEN of our the best of apps from 2009 and we hope you enjoy them at this incredibly low, low price!  There's hours of fun to be had by all - from the frantic finger stabbing game play in iDare Deluxe to blasting aliens in Retro Shoot. There's something for everyone in the family in this quality packed compilation.  1. DropSum ************************ Enjoyed by over 7.5 million PC users worldwide, Dropsum will stretch your mental agility and give your brain a good work out. Match up tiles that add up to 9 in this addictive maths tile game.  2. Retro Shoot ************************ We've taken the great gameplay from the 80s and brought it bang up to date with vibrant neon graphics and pulse pumping music and sounds. There are 15 levels of action to play in this fast moving space shooter.  3. iDare Deluxe ************************ iDare Deluxe tests your finger dexterity to the max. In this fully featured version of the ‘Five Finger Fillet’ game you can impress your family and friends with your accurate touch skills. The FREE version of iDare has been played by over 3.5 million gamers, now you can own the full version with 5 game modes, 4 combinations of stabbing and 6 different hand styles.  4. iLooney ************************ It's nice and bright outside and the Looney is stuck inside with nothing but the voices in his head to keep him company. Looney is making a run for it;  only one thing stands in his way - you! This turn based game with its great lunatic voice over will make you laugh and challenge your ability to think aheard a crazy dude in a straigh jacket!  5. iBlow ************************ The application that lets you blow realistic bubbles on your iPhone. Simply blow gently and steadily into the microphone and your virtual bubble will expand in size. When it's just the size you want, give an extra strong blow and it will release and wobble  around. You can then gently push it with your fingers or hit it in the centre to pop it. iBlow is a fun and creative app that you and your family will love. You can even blow bubbles that contain your own photos.  6. Touch & Go ******************* This is a fun and innovative “match 3” casual game that uses the touch input of your device to the max. The rules are simple, drag the blocks and throw them together. When three or more of the same color collide they all explode. Just don’t let the blocks pile-up too high. If they stack to the top then your game is over. Touch & Go is a great time filler and has beautiful graphics too!  7.Smack It Deluxe ************************ In this exciting and fast paced game your reactions are tested to the max. We all love Wack-a-mole from the arcades and this game uses the same hit reaction game play. Kids will love Smack It Deluxe as they compete to be the best.  8. Mission Control ************************ In this game you've been employed to direct the flight paths of all incoming and outgoing ships.  Rise through the ranks from a lowly Rookie to the respected role as a Mission Controller. The game needs keen concentration as you direct multiple ships to and from the refuelling depos.  9. iMoon Walk ************************ The lights are low, the atmosphere is electric, the music is on, the dance floor is gleaming, there is only one thing missing - You! Help move the feet of the dancer as fast as you can in this simple and fun speed and dexterity challenge game.  10. iDork Lite ************************ Lost in a world of school paperwork is 'iDork' your doodled stick man who needs help to escape the reams of homework sheets that are his prison. iDork is very sensitive and has to avoid many dangers across 20 levels of play. A great adventure game awaits you!", "genre": ["Adventure"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2010-03-27", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-147422-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-147422-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["The Game Creators (Developer)", "The Game Creators (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

{"title": "DropZap 2", "title_search": "dropzap 2", "title_keyword": "dropzap 2", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/dropzap-2/", "summary": "DropZap 2 is a NOT a color matching game! Rather, you SHRINK pieces until they disappear! DropZap 2 takes gameplay from the original DropZap to a whole new level by having two kinds of pieces -- one behaving identically to pieces in DropZap and another that prevents lasers from reaching other pieces. Gameplay video: http://www.dropzap2.com If you are a fan of the original DropZap -- or games such as Tetris, Drop7, Bejeweled 2, etc. -- then you will definitely want to check out DropZap 2! DropZap 2 supports Game Center, the Retina display, and fast app switching (subject to availability on your device). HOW TO PLAY Tap/drag to select the column where you want the circle to land. When any piece lands, it SHRINKS pieces below and sideways. The smallest square, colored red, disappears when shrunk. Squares and gaps, unlike circles, stop lasers from reaching pieces. Your game ends when the grid is full or piece(s) go beyond the top. When a piece disappears, any piece(s) above it will fall, potentially resulting in other pieces disappearing, and so on. Chain reactions can be quite elaborate and are an integral part of gameplay. GAME MODES (1) Standard: Remove (at least) 50 pieces to proceed to the next level. (2) Relentless: There is only one level that never ends. (3) Action: Remove (at least) 50 pieces to proceed to the next level. Quick thinking is required. (4) Relentless Action: There is only one level that never ends. Quick thinking is required. (5) Two Players: This a split-screen mode where two players compete using the same device. The player who removes 25 more pieces than his/her opponent or outlasts his/her opponent wins. GAME CENTER AND LOCAL SCORES Single player game modes have global scores via Game Center. You can see previous local scores from single player games whether or not you use Game Center. === Background images credit: NASA/courtesy of nasaimages.org.", "genre": ["Strategy"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2010-10-23", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-169689-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-169689-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Amir Michail (Developer)", "Amir Michail (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Steel Calvary", "title_search": "steel calvary", "title_keyword": "steel calvary", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/steel-calvary/", "summary": "In Steel Calvary - Panzer Destroyer, you are assigned to command a tank platoon during WWII. {"title": "Internet Channel", "title_search": "internet channel", "title_keyword": "internet channel", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/internet-channel/", "summary": "Available to download for free, the Internet Channel brings the web to your TV and makes surfing a social experience! It's also a great way to watch funny online videos together with friends, as others in the room can use extra Wii Remotes to point out things that catch their eye.\r \r The fast-booting Internet browser will create a new relationship between the family, the TV and the Internet. This Channel uses the full Internet browser from Opera Software, which also supports Adobe Flash.\r \r Take a closer look\r Zoom in and out of the page you are looking at by pressing the + and  Buttons on the Wii Remote and scroll by holding the B Button and pointing in the direction you want the page to move.\r \r Unobstructed view\r Pressing the 1 Button will hide the navigation bar and give you a full-screen view of the page you are visiting.\r \r Searching simplified\r Whenever youre entering a web address or searching for a keyword, you can switch the auto-fill function on or off by pointing at the arrow icon below the text box and pressing the A Button.\r \r Enter the Settings menu to alter your display options and decide which search engine you want to use as your default.", "genre": ["Application"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2006-12-08", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-80574-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-80574-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["Europe", "North America"], "companies": ["Nintendo (Publisher)", "Opera (Developer)"], "platforms": ["Wii"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Sherlock Holmes: The Awakened (2007)", "title_search": "sherlock holmes the awakened 2007", "title_keyword": "sherlock holmes the awakened 2007", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/sherlock-holmes-the-awakened-2007/", "summary": "A veritable adventure game licence, Sherlock Holmes returns in a superb third episode that gives a whole new angle to the series. The game rises to the challenge of being entirely in 3D; while the creators have kept classic game mechanics, the game benefits from the freedom and the immersion brought by a superb animated  and detailed real time 3D environment. The game has traditional Point & Click game play, in a real time 3D environment, while offering numerous enigmas and varied puzzles including some that use physics and light for the first time. The game plunges the player into the heart of a terrifying investigation. Sherlock Holmes, assisted by the loyal Doctor Watson, investigates strange disappearances which seem related to the activity of a secret sect. The adventure begins in London, in the renowned Baker Street, taking us then to investigate a disturbing psychiatric hospital near Bale, Switzerland, then on to Louisiana and finally to Scotland. [Ascaron]", "genre": ["Adventure"], "metascore": "72", "critic_reviews": 28, "user_score": "7.3", "user_reviews": 47, "release_date": "2007-03-01", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/3/6-1-80613-13.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-80617-52.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": "Mixed or average", "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["Europe", "North America"], "companies": ["Focus Home Interactive (Publisher)", "Frogwares (Developer)"], "platforms": ["PC", "iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": "M"}
